text: Adenomus is a small genus of true toads. It only has three species. These all live in Sri Lanka. Adenomus kandianus was thought to be extinct for 133 years. It was rediscovered in October 2009 in the Kandy area. ==Species== Binomial Name and Author Common name Adenomus dasi Adenomus kandianus Kandyan Dwarf Toad Adenomus kelaartii Kelaart's Toad ==References== * * amphibiaweb.org Adenomus kandianus * Global Amphibian Assessment - Adenomus kandianus * Manamendra-Arachchi, K., Pethiyagoda, R. (1998). A synopsis of the Sri Lankan Bufonidae (Amphibia: Anura), with description of two new species. J. South Asian nat. Hist., 3(2), 213-248. * Dutta, S.K. & Manamendra-Arachchi, K. (1996). The Amphibian Fauna of Sri Lanka. WHT, Colombo, Sri Lanka. Category:Toads Category:Sri Lanka Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Adenomus
